image.altText: a young girl

props.synopsis: A Gold Coast community is asking what more could have been done after the death of a little girl, allegedly at the hands of her mother.

title.children: Schoolgirl's alleged murder 'like a bomb' in Gold Coast's tight-knit Chinese community

image.altText: A wide shot of the Train's home, with two sheds and a dam in sight.

props.synopsis: A woman close with Nathaniel, who made the missing person's report after not seeing him in person for 12 months, gives evidence at the Wieambilla shooting inquest.

title.children: Wieambilla inquest hears haunting final message to woman who reported Nathaniel Train missing

image.altText: A man in a grey suit and a woman in a white top standing together

props.synopsis: Health authorities are contact tracing and preparing to ramp up a vaccination program in a regional Queensland community after two children were diagnosed with the potentially lethal disease.

title.children: Child in community near Cairns in serious condition with meningococcal B

image.altText: A close up of a woman looking out a window.

props.synopsis: Peter Dutton's call for a temporary ban on accepting Palestinian refugees from Gaza has fuelled government accusations he is dividing the community.

title.children: Independent MP who fled war says debate over Gaza refugee ban is 'triggering', as Peter Dutton doubles down

image.altText: A Virgin plane flying in the sky in Brisbane.

props.synopsis: Today the airport released five proposed flight paths to curb noise pollution — or rather, to spread it over more suburbs so it's less concentrated in some.

title.children: Brisbane Airport plan proposes 'sharing' aircraft noise over more of the city

image.altText: Man and woman smile at camera with Greek houses made from white concrete behind them

props.synopsis: Andrew and Michele are dipping into their retirement funds to travel the world, and they don't feel guilty about it. Their daughters are financially independent, which they credit to early education on money matters.

title.children: This couple aren't supporting their kids in retirement. They credit early financial education

image.altText: An aerial view showing farmland and all of the development around it with the ocean in the background.

props.synopsis: A 39-hectare working farm in the heart of the Sunshine Coast's most urbanised area could become a technology village under an idea proposed by the region's former mayor.

title.children: Final farm in Maroochydore could become eight-storey 'tech village' under development proposal

image.altText: A group of women sit on picnic rugs under a tree in a park.

props.synopsis: Loneliness can increase the risk of developing health complications, so these women are finding new friendships among the strangers they share park picnics with.

title.children: Making friends as an adult can be hard, so these picnics are helping break the loneliness cycle

image.altText: Sand and water at a beach framed by palm trees and Castle Hill in Townsville.

props.synopsis: About 3,000 athletes are set to compete in the World Triathlon Multisport World Championships in Townsville, in an Australian-first event spanning 11 days.

title.children: Thousands of athletes descend on North Queensland for 'Mount Everest' of endurance events

image.altText: Melbourne CBD people retail shopping

props.synopsis: The unemployment rate climbs to 4.2 per cent in July, despite data from the Australian Bureau of Statistics showing more than 58,000 people found work last month.

title.children: Unemployment rate climbs to 4.2 per cent in July despite 58,000 people finding work

image.altText: Elderly women with curly hair and glasses standing at the window with the curtains drawn

props.synopsis: Like millions of Australians, Doreen Fawcett is grappling with a nightmare of unwanted power bill complexity. Calls for simplification are growing.

title.children: Perplexing, punishing power prices force industry to concede ‘smart’ meter overhaul not so clever

image.altText: Dr Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus

props.synopsis: The latest outbreak of mpox is different to the one that spread around the world in 2022 — and has experts on high alert

title.children: Mpox is now a global health emergency. Here's what that means for Australia

image.altText: A man looks at the camera with a neutral expression. Behind him a canal and a restaurant are visible.

props.synopsis: A "hero" security guard who tackled a knife-wielding man and freed the young Australian girl he'd been stabbing in a London shop has been honoured for his bravery.

title.children: A man wielding a knife attacked an 11yo Aussie girl in London. Then Abdullah 'jumped on the guy'

image.altText: Anthony Albanese confused in QT

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese and Peter Dutton trade barbs over what Australia's spy boss is saying about Gaza visa applications as the fallout continues over the opposition leader's remarks. Follow live.

title.children: PM accused of misquoting top spy, Dutton told to 'stop being racist'

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Dutton hits back at Zali Steggall
CFMEU vote to go ahead today
Tensions bubble over in the corridors of Parliament House

image.altText: A close up of Yahya Sinwa at a rally among a crowd of people.

props.synopsis: Three senior Iranian officials have said that only a ceasefire deal in Gaza would hold Iran back from direct retaliation against Israel for the assassination of Hamas leader Ismail Haniyeh.

title.children: Hamas to stay out of Gaza truce talks but may meet mediators afterwards

image.altText: Blake Wilson

props.synopsis: The helicopter pilot who was killed after crashing into the roof of a Cairns hotel moved to Queensland in April, declaring on social media he was "excited to see what this adventure brings".

title.children: What we know about Blake Wilson, the pilot of the helicopter that crashed into a Cairns hotel

image.altText: Marist Brother Gerard McNamara enters the Victorian County Court wearing dark sunglasses.

props.synopsis: Gerard McNamara's most notorious years were the 1970s, when he was a principal, head of sport and later in a welfare role at St Paul's Catholic College in Traralgon, now known as Lavalla Catholic College.

title.children: Notorious paedophile Marist Brother Gerard 'The Rat' McNamara to be released

image.altText: A close up of a stone cross on top of a church roof with grey background.

props.synopsis: The identities of child abusers should be listed on the website of the institution they belong to and as part of a centrally accessible register of perpetrators, a parliamentary inquiry finds.

title.children: 'Unholy wall of silence': Inquiry slams Christian Brothers for trying to hide abuse and limit payouts

image.altText: Crime figure Gavin Preston looks unsmilingly into the camera as he poses for a photo.

props.synopsis: Two men accused of the daylight assassination of underworld figure Gavin Preston have pleaded not guilty to murder and are now set to face a Supreme Court trial.

title.children: Pair plead not guilty to the murder of Melbourne crime figure Gavin Preston

image.altText: A teacher is seen at the front of a primary school classroom

props.synopsis: Upwey South Primary School's academic results have lifted dramatically over the past six years. The principal puts it down to a shift in teaching styles.

title.children: This public school's academic results have skyrocketed over the past six years. Here's how they did it

image.altText: News presenter Bridget Brennan stands at a desk in a TV studio, smiling. She is wearing a pink dress.

props.synopsis: Bridget Brennan will be the new co-host of ABC News Breakfast, taking over from Lisa Millar when she farewells the show in late August.

title.children: 'An important moment for my mob': Bridget Brennan to co-host ABC News Breakfast

image.altText: A photo of a Disney Springs sign.

props.synopsis: Disney has challenged a wrongful death lawsuit after a 42-year-old New York doctor died in one of its theme parks — arguing signing up for its streaming service means giving up the right to sue it.

title.children: Subscribing to a streaming service means you give up any rights to sue, Disney has argued in court

image.altText: A young boy dances in front of the Camps Breakerz studio in the Nuseirat refugee camp in the Gaza Strip.

props.synopsis: In the middle of a war zone in Gaza, children are performing breakdancing flips and jumps between the rubble. Meet the breakdancing crew keeping hope alive.

title.children: 'Breaking can heal trauma': Children in Gaza breakdance to hold on to hope

image.altText: Collingwood coach Craig McRae

props.synopsis: Just days after causing a major stir with his post-match comments on the AFL's umpires, Collingwood coach Craig McRae has changed his tune.

title.children: Collingwood coach Craig McRae disappointed after 'selfish' home ground bias claim on AFL umpires

image.altText: A medieval man holds a phone with the Sportsbet logo displayed.

props.synopsis: Changes to gambling advertising won't happen until next month at the earliest as the government scrambles to manage a caucus pushback and resistance from the crossbenches.

title.children: Government pushes back gambling advertising reforms, tussling over internal resistance

image.altText: Two men shake hands.

props.synopsis: A Pacific archipelago in Australia's backyard has become a new front in a bitter feud between France and Azerbaijan.

title.children: How a tourist mecca off Australia's coast got entangled in France's feud with an enemy

image.altText: Two soldiers sit on top of a small tank, driving in front of a second small tank, on a deserted road.

props.synopsis: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has said more than 100 Russian soldiers had been captured as prisoners of war, to "speed up the return home of our boys and girls".

title.children: Ukrainian forces 'moving further' into Russia as more than 100 soldiers captured, Zelenskyy says

image.altText: Saline drip

props.synopsis: Patients are having to stay in hospital for longer periods and some elective surgeries face delays because of a global shortage of intravenous fluids, which doctors say they have been left "in the dark" about.

title.children: Patients forced to stay in hospital care units for longer amid IV fluid shortage

image.altText: Four pineapple flavoured sweets in a yellow wrapped which actually contain meth

props.synopsis: Police recover nearly 30 blocks of the drug disguised as branded lollies and say circulation appears to be within the Auckland region.

title.children: Meth lollies distributed by New Zealand food bank 'likely from a smuggling operation gone wrong'

image.altText: Film still of titular creature from Alien leaning in, jaws open, terrorising a female hanging from a ladder, cowering in fear

props.synopsis: What happens when Disney takes over the long-running sci-fi franchise? Well, as well as a new director and a new cast, there are still plenty of gross xenomorphs.

title.children: The latest Alien remake begs the question: Is anyone going to match Ridley Scott's freak?

image.altText: A full moon is seen through clouds above Stonehenge

props.synopsis: The Altar Stone, long believed to have come from Wales, may have been transported via sea from Scotland, according to new research from an Australian team.

title.children: 'Completely unexpected': Stonehenge's central stone may have come from 700km away, new research suggests

image.altText: Two women look at a share price board outside the ASX in Sydney.

props.synopsis: The ASX200 jumps higher after US inflation falls below 3 per cent, but Telstra profits are down 12.8 per cent. There are signs Australia's economy is continuing to contract, with a jump in the employment rate.

title.children: Unemployment rises, ASX200 jumps higher after US inflation declines, Telstra profits down 12.8 per cent

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Iron ore price hits another low
Government to guarantee Rex flight bookings for next month
Which US politician can win over crypto voters?

image.altText: A girl in school uniform shows a phone to two boys in uniform.

props.synopsis: In public schools across Australia, kids are getting used to phone bans — and politicians are spruiking big improvements in student behaviour. But not everyone is convinced.

title.children: Mobile phones are now banned in public schools across Australia. Here's how kids think it's going
